WorkItem.Description: Resilience/Resilience Rating are not being assigned survivability values for mages, and perhaps other classes.  Any value would be better than being left out entirely.  An options field under survivability would make sense for tweaking the value.

Comments.Message: Resilience has value if you're using the survivability settings. Set incoming damage and its crit rate and set survivability score to greater than 0.

With the following settings, 95 resilience trinkets have a value of 0.

Survivability Rating : 1
Melee DPS: 3000
Melee CritRate: 30
Physical DPS: 3000
Physical CritRate: 30
Physical Dot: 800
Survivability Score: 10
a possibility occured to me that the engine may have a resilience rating cap for level 70.

The survivability model for mage module is based on the chance that you'll die before the healers can react. You can see this at the bottom of the info panel in survivability section. Most likely cause for 0 value is if you set the incoming damage too low or too high. At one case you won't die regardless of resillience, at the other extreme you'll die anyway no matter how much resillience you have. So you should find a soft spot in the middle that represents what you want. The default healer response time is 5 seconds, so raw damage should be somewhere in the ballpark of your health divided by 5. So you probably have too much damage in that profile. Also the crit rate should be set as value between 0 and 1, so 0.3 in your case. Let me know if you need further help in getting this working the way you want.

I apologize for not getting back to you.  I can only guess that the value for resilience is kept within the optimizer routine.  No settings in the survivability tab can alter the item comparison list's value for resilience rating.  The list ignores resilience entirely.  If it weren't for the high amount of stamina on pvp pieces, I have little reason to expect even the optimizer to select items for their resilience.

Survivability model in Rawr.Mage should give value to resilience when set properly. Can you attach a character xml where you've set the survivability parameters and you can't get a value for resilience?
